message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about weather and the characteristics of sleet. Sleet is a type of precipitation that consists of ice pellets or frozen raindrops. It can be potentially dangerous because it can create slippery conditions on roads and walkways, leading to an increased risk of accidents. Option (B) is incorrect because sleet is not poison. Option (C) is incorrect because sleet is not hot. Option (D) is incorrect because sleet is not inherently unhealthy, although it can contribute to hazardous conditions.

It can make roads and sidewalks slippery, leading to potentially dangerous conditions. Option (B) is incorrect because sleet is not poisonous. Option (C) is incorrect because sleet is not hot. Option (D) is incorrect because sleet does not have any direct negative health effects.
